content: Insurance Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 31 Dec 2018Asked a loved one of mine to cancel their pulsar plan and I dont know if it it the right decision to make?There is surrender value of about 1.5k after surrendering. After reading many threads, I do feel insurance should not be mixed with investment. Am I giving the right advice to cancel?5 answersAnswerBump0

Luke Ho, Money Maverick at Money MaverickLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 02 Jan 2019It's very reckless to cancel something based on reading off a bunch of threads. Accurately, Pulsar typically doesn't have an insurance element. There still has to be a lot more specifics like how long the plan has been going on - and you have to remember that high fees are offset by the starting bonus. Something that has that much of a headstart and compounding exponentially can easily offset high fees. Easily. And you can only determine exponential compounding by going over the asset allocation. Which you should do. Justify the cancellation on a wide range of information, not limited ones. Aside from that, if you're going to tell someone to cancel a plan and lose their money, TAKE responsibility for it. They have to be actively doing something to make that the money and show them projections for reassurance, at the very least. 0 comments2
